statement.p: Your friend Amber and you decide to order a pizza and are debating between ordering a medium, which costs 15.99, versus a large, which costs 18.99. Since you know geometry, you decided to math this out.
Here are the medium (left) and large (right) pizzas.
The diameter of the large pizza is times as large as the medium pizza.
What is the area of the medium pizza? Round your answer to the nearest tenth. \displaystyle\text{in}^{{2}}
What is the area of the large pizza? Round your answer to the nearest tenth. \displaystyle\text{in}^{{2}}
The area of the large pizza is times as large as the medium pizza.
If the medium pizza costs 15.99 , how much should the large pizza cost to have each square inch of pizza be of equal value? Round your answer to the nearest cent.
Recall that the costs of the pizzas were 15.99 and 18.99. Which pizza is the better deal? (Assume more pizza per dollar = better.)

ol.li: They are the same price per square inch.
